findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 21 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act — including entities with no active directors or facing strike-off. Verified against Companies House records.

findings.label: Missing Transaction Descriptions
findings.detail: None of the 30,580 spending records include a description of what was purchased — the worst transparency gap of any East Lancashire council. All 3 neighbours include descriptions.

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 602 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week. Many may be legitimate phased payments, but the volume warrants review.

findings.label: Missing Department Data
findings.detail: 4,044 transactions (13.2%) have no department assigned — makes it impossible to track which services are spending. Hyndburn and Pendle achieve near-100% department tagging.

findings.label: March Spending Premium
findings.detail: March spending averages 1.4x the monthly average (£8.5M vs £6M). A mild year-end pattern — October is actually the highest month at £9.5M avg.

key_findings.title: Molesworth Hotel Ltd: £59.1K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: No active directors; No person with significant control registered. Council paid this company despite Companies House non-compliance.

key_findings.title: JML Property Solutions Ltd: £48.0K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Company facing strike-off proceedings. Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments.

key_findings.title: Zero descriptions: every transaction is opaque
key_findings.description: Burnley publishes supplier names and amounts but never describes what was purchased. Hyndburn, Pendle, and Rossendale all include descriptions for their payments.

key_findings.title: URBASER LTD: 959 transactions totalling £19.5M
key_findings.description: Averaging £20.3K per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier. Waste collection contract.

key_findings.title: 38 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £102.2M total
key_findings.description: Capita, Civica, EDF Energy, Stannah and 34 others serve multiple East Lancashire councils. Compare pricing across all 4 councils.

key_findings.title: EDF Energy: Burnley pays £25K avg vs Pendle £282 per transaction
key_findings.description: £3.2M to EDF across 128 transactions. Different contract structures explain the gap — Burnley likely has a direct supply agreement vs Pendle's framework purchases.
